message.content:
cs.CR, cs.DC, cs.NI, cs.GT, cs.SI 

This paper discusses the probability of success of block-hiding mining strategies in Bitcoin-like networks, which involves building a secret branch of the block-tree and publishing it opportunistically. This topic falls under the category of computer security (cs.CR) as it deals with the security of the Bitcoin network. Additionally, the paper involves analyzing the influence of miners on the network, which falls under the categories of distributed computing (cs.DC) and networking and internet architecture (cs.NI). The paper also involves game theory analysis, which falls under the category of theoretical computer science (cs.GT). Finally, the paper discusses the generalization of a measure for a miner's influence on the network, which falls under the category of social and information networks (cs.SI).
